title: B2 Cambridge Use of English - Multiple Choice

sentences.q: His mistake was _______ as a vital part of the theory.
Peter is going to _______ the post as Manager of the Sales Department.
Mary was accused _______ breaking the window.
I don't think I know the answer to that question, but I'll _______ and see if I can remember.
Some people find it _______ to believe that the earth is round.
A person who is always _______ is a nuisance.
People like John are always ready to _______ you a helping hand.
_______ the long distance he came on foot.
James tried to hide the _______ key in his hands.
As we have plenty of time we _______ go to the cinema.
When the bus arrived everyone got _______.
We had better _______ plenty of fresh air in the house.
When he was being so _______, he broke the glass.
As soon as the show was _______, the children went home.
If you want to pass, you must work _______.
Mary's _______ made the children laugh.
We must always _______ the rules at school.
It was _______ a big company that he was given a car.
The _______ prize was given to the best runner.
When I was at school I _______ to play tennis.
The children could see the _______ debating in the House of Commons.
He is too _______ to walk alone at night.
They _______ him to go with them but he refused.
I would like you to look after my dog _______ I am away.
The teacher _______ him for cheating in the test.
I think the film was _______ interesting.
We arrived _______ time to see the performance.
She _______ to see us off at the airport.
_______ I like him very much, he is not the right person for this job.
It was _______ for me to leave the office.
You must hand in your composition _______ Friday at the latest.
The _______ of the cake is really good.
It's no use _______ over spilt milk.
She's fond _______ swimming in the sea.
The teacher told the class to pay _______ to what he was saying.
If you had _______ earlier, you wouldn't have missed the train.
_______ the bus fare home, she walked.
You must be _______ before you start working here.
When I passed the exam, my parents were very _______.
His speech made a deep _______ on the audience.
I tried to _______ him not to go there, but he wouldn't listen.
She was very _______ at the thought of going abroad.
I'm going to have my car _______.
She _______ to read the book.
The director _______ the actors carefully.
His parents won't let him _______ TV late at night.
Don't forget _______ the door before you leave.
Her illness prevented her _______ coming to the party.
I _______ to meeting you at the party.
As prices _______, demand decreases.
Mary is almost well again now, but she still looks rather _______.
The Council meeting was very badly _______.
I feel so sleepy, I can hardly _______ my eyes open.
A snake _______ its skin.
When we were repairing the fence, we found _______ under a stone.
After walking for hours in the pouring rain, the children were _______ to the skin.
You must take _______ of your health.
The Grand Hotel, _______, provides for a single room with breakfast.
She was _______ that she cried.
The new computer is very _______ for the work.
He was afraid _______ the dog would bite him.
The house has been in our family for many _______.
Fresh air is _______ to good health.
She comes of a/an _______ family.
I think he is going to _______ me a letter.
There are many _______ connected with his work.
They have gone abroad _______ business.
He tried to _______ me from joining the club.
His house is built _______ stone.
The price was so high that I couldn't _______ it.
As soon as she entered the Park I _______ her at once.
The train was so packed that I had to _______ all the way.
The baby began to cry but I _______ him to sleep.
Peter was _______ for two hours in the rain.
He is so _______ that everybody likes him.
There are several _______ to every good school.
He is _______ with the English language.
John prefers _______ at home to going out.
I was delighted to hear your good _______.
I _______ myself in the mirror.
Don't believe him. He's _______ you.
After the new secretary came, the office _______ much better.
His _______ is in plastics.
Our train was late because of a _______ on the line.
I advised him to _______ his error.
Try to make your story as _______ as possible.
He was _______ from the party for bad behavior.
My father has gone abroad on important _______.
A _______ is a person who makes bread.
He is fond of _______ books.
_______ my studies, I play in a band.
You can hardly _______ him to change his mind.
No one is _______ to leave the room.
There were three people in the _______ besides me.
Both sisters are very _______.
The medicine produced an immediate _______.
I had the _______ to meet the president.
The teacher _______ the students not to be late.
You _______ not smoke on the bus.
A thermometer is an instrument used to _______ temperature.
There was a loud _______, and a large hole appeared in the ice.
He wasn't a very experienced worker and he had difficulty in _______ his job.
The man jumped out of the window and committed _______.
I don't like my drink cooked very much; I like it _______.
Some students are so _______ that they cannot make up their minds.
Peter was in a hurry and left his bicycle _______.
Jim's uncle is teaching him how to _______ a car.
It _______ two years for me to build this house.
The look in his eyes showed that he was _______.
There was an odd _______ on the shelf.
Pat took me to the place where she _______.
A _______ is an underground passage.
John looked at the suitcase and asked what it _______.
The dress you are wearing is very _______.
He was very _______ because he was thinking of his test results.
He got so _______ when he heard he had lost the competition.
The _______ for the best essay was given to John.
The train _______ the platform and we had to run to catch it.
I visit my grandmother _______ Sundays.
Mary was _______ because she was not allowed to go to the party.
That exam was too difficult for me; I couldn't _______ it.
It's a _______ day for a picnic.
If you want to find the answer, look it up in the _______.
My father made me _______ the house.
A doctor must treat every patient as a/an _______.
At a trial, a witness is someone who _______.
Could you _______ me £5? I'll pay you back tomorrow.
You can't smoke here, it's not _______.
He hammered a _______ into the wall.
All students must buy the necessary _______.
Which one word fits all these: a room, an officer, a hotel?
In a foreign language class you practise both writing and _______.
The children asked me _______ them a new story.
I am not going into someone else's _______.
Mr. Jones is very thin because he always goes on a _______.
Tom writes a lot at work: writing outside the office hours _______ fatigue.
I'm going _______ you if you keep on talking.
The shop manager said he'd give you a _______.
We thought it very _______ to leave our luggage unattended.
The Company gave his father a gold watch on his _______ from service.
The man was tried for _______ after making the confession.
I won't lend you my bicycle, because you never give it _______.
The children always look _______ to Christmas.
The new motorway is being built _______.
Their _______ was to raise money for the old people's home.
John didn't _______ for the examination.
My brother got a _______ in the Government's Housing Project.
We visit our grandparents quite _______.
He _______ his seat as soon as the old lady came in.
At school we used to learn all the capitals of Europe _______ heart.
She shaped the clay into a _______.
My cousin, who lives in France, is _______ French.
I am going to _______ a few days in the country with Jane.
A passport is necessary if you wish to _______ the country.
Peter has not got the right _______ for that occupation.
The students are writing an _______ on the environment.
The teacher always gives the children _______ questions.
There was a loud noise in the high street which attracted a large _______.
Mr. Smith was _______ to hear that his brother had won the first prize.
It has always been a _______ with the Browns to have turkey at Christmas.
The shops are very crowded _______ Saturdays.
If you are worried about your health you ought to _______ advice from your doctor.
When Peter heard the news, he couldn't _______ a word.
My younger brother has a great _______ for drawing.
Has it _______ you that we've met before?
During the trial, the woman was accused of telling a _______.
Most people would rather live in the _______ than in a town.
It's very _______ to find a snake in England.
Do you know the _______ to the Town Hall?
He _______ me for being late.
The teacher asked the students to repeat the sentence _______.
My brother _______ to drive before he was seventeen.
I never go out in bad weather if I can _______.
There's no _______ doing it now, as everyone's left.
If you have any trouble, just let me _______.
He _______ to be a very good student.
The news was _______ on TV at 9 o'clock.
My family is moving to a new _______ at the end of the month.
He was very _______ when he heard the result.
The nurse told him to _______ the medicine.
The _______ of the machine is very easy to learn.
Bread is made from _______.
The teacher told the class to stop _______ at once.
You can _______ me at my office at any time.
He tried to _______ the crying baby.
The letter was _______ by hand.
The _______ of the story is not difficult.
It's not _______ to change your mind several times a day.
All the students ought to obey the _______.
He was so angry that he _______ the door behind him.
The _______ of the United States is quite high.
The _______ is the man in charge of a school.
I am _______ to living in a cold climate now.
The police tried to _______ him for speeding.
The _______ of the mountain can be beautiful in winter.
The children all _______ to the teacher's story.
Her health has _______ a lot since last year.
I _______ that the course will be difficult.
She _______ a letter from her friend yesterday.
A nurse is a person who _______ the sick.
I let my friend _______ on a secret.
I shall always _______ not going on a trip to Paris when I had the chance.
The old clown was _______ sight, standing there with tears running down his cheeks.
That was a _______ of luck, wasn't it?
I wish I _______ more time before you went and bought that car.
There was nothing for it _______ to get off the bus and walk the rest of the way.
In my opinion, they should re-organise the whole company.
She was suddenly _______ ill during the night and died the following morning.
I can't concentrate _______ this music.
She was _______ that we could go and see her in hospital.
I don't _______ agree with what you're saying.
Our hosts _______ us a very warm welcome.
I _______ him for someone else.
Can you hold the ladder _______ while I climb up and pick the apples?
We should have a good day tomorrow. The weather has been _______ fine.
You can _______ this road until you reach the traffic lights.
This powerful nation is putting _______ on its weaker neighbour to give up some valuable land.
I must apologise that my delay in answering your letter is due mainly to laziness.
Your _______ for the post will be considered by the committee next week.
_______ his retirement pension he has no income of any kind.
The need for international action to prevent war between the two nations is _______.
The clerk was asked to _______ a number of mistakes in book-keeping he had made.
He sat all day silently watching the fire and seemed to have no _______ at all left in him.
Scientists have carried out a great deal of _______ in the field of genetic engineering.
The colour of the dress was quite different under _______ light.
You have good reason not to trust him, but this time he is _______ trying to help you.
I think the birds must have eaten all the seeds I _______ last year!
Jim has _______ with flu.
When the snow finally _______, it flooded a lot of the area.
The driver might have _______ the accident if he had had his headlights on.
I have a vague _______ of going there once, but I don't remember when.
Despite being easy-going with their children, they were both brought up very _______.
Please accept my _______ for not coming to the meeting last week.
I wouldn't _______ of letting the children do such a thing.
If I hadn't _______ so much for the carpet, I would have bought it.
The flowers were _______ more expensive than he thought they would be.
I wouldn't be _______ to see him at the party tonight.
The storm did so much damage that over 500 people were made _______.
He refused to give up working _______ he was 75.
They were _______ for smuggling jewellery into the country.
